item.title: Developing: PlayStation Network Down Worldwide
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/playstation-network-down-worldwide/

It‚Äôs not just you. The PlayStation Network is down for everyone.

Outages began appearing around 6pm ET, according to multiple reports. A visit to the official PlayStation status page shows that all services are down, including the PlayStation Store, gaming, account management, and more.

As of writing there is no official word from PlayStation regarding the outage. Nor is there any idea as to when service will be restored.

Based on a preliminary check, it appears to be only PlayStation Network suffering issues. Other major online services such as Xbox Live, Nintendo Online, and Steam appear to be working as expected.

Insider Gaming will continue to provide updates as they become available.

Developing story‚Ä¶

Take-Two Stock Hits All-Time High After GTA 6 Update

After GTA 6‚Äôs Fall 2025 release window was reconfirmed, Take-Two‚Äôs stocks have reached an all-time high. Here are more details.

In a new interview, soon-to-be former president of Insomniac Games Ted Price said that the studio pitched Resistance 4 to PlayStation.

Next Balatro Update Details Intentionally Being Kept Under Wraps

Details for the next major Balatro update are intentionally being kept under wraps by the game‚Äôs developer, LocalThunk.

Magic: The Gathering Film and TV Universe Announced 

Hasbro and Legendary Entertainment have announced Magic: The Gathering Film and TV universe. Here are more details.

item.title: ‚ÄòYou Just Can‚Äôt Beat Me‚Äô ‚Äì M80 Gunnar Goes Off Against Liquid at Six Invitational
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/m80-gunnar-team-liquid-six-invitational/

Earlier today, M80 dominated Team Liquid in the group stage of the Six Invitational 2025 tournament. This super-sized event boasts a $3 million prize pool and is one of the most important tournaments in the annual esports calendar, so it comes as no surprise that emotions can run wild.

Following the 2 ‚Äì 1 win over Team Liquid, M80‚Äôs Shaun ‚ÄòGunnar‚Äô Pottorff blew up behind the scenes, with the moments after the victory just about being captured by M80‚Äôs social team.

‚ÄòIt Doesn‚Äôt Matter What Team I‚Äôm On‚Äô

Gunnar has been around the block against Team Liquid. The comments he made following M80‚Äôs win in the group stage of this year‚Äôs Six Invitational were backed up by cold, hard numbers. In recent years, Gunnar has taken down Team Liquid while being a part of three separate rosters.

He did it with Soniqs, then against with beastcoast, and now with M80.

After our WIN vs LIQUID ‚ûû Take a look INSIDE the ARENA! üèü

In 2024, Gunnar and beastcoast stormed to success at the BLAST Manchester Major, securing the organisation‚Äôs first major win. That victory included the brutal knocking out of Team Liquid. Beastcoat eliminated the Brazilian squad without dropping a map, before going on to beat Team BDS 3 ‚Äì 2 in the grand final.

Gunnar had sharp words for Team Liquid following today‚Äôs win:

You can‚Äôt beat me! You guys just can‚Äôt beat me. It doesn‚Äôt matter what team I‚Äôm on.

That‚Äôs three different teams ‚Äì you can‚Äôt beat me.

Three different teams, three different rosters, same f***ing results, bro.

M80 picked up the former beastcoast roster following the disbanding of the team in the run-up to the Six Invitational 2025. Thus far in the tournament, M80 has performed pretty well, and at the time of writing, the team sat in second place in the group, just a few points behind G2 Esports, the favourite to win the event.

This weekend, the Six Invitational will depart the group stage and enter the playoffs bracket, with the bottom teams in each group being effectively eliminated from the running.

Are you enjoying this year‚Äôs Six Invitational? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming esports, check out Derke‚Äôs insane VALORANT play

item.title: Take-Two Stock Hits All-Time High After GTA 6 Update
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/take-two-stock-hits-all-time-high-after-gta-6-update/

Take-Two stocks have reached an all-time high after reconfirming that GTA 6 will be releasing fall 2025. 

Spotted by videotechuk_ on X, after CEO Strauss Zelnick reaffirmed a fall 2025 release date for GTA 6 at their recent earnings call, Take-Two‚Äôs stocks started climbing, creating a new record today. Take-Two Interactive Software‚Äôs stock opened at $198, reached a high of almost $213, and closed at $208.77. The company‚Äôs confidence has reassured investors.

GTA 6 is the most anticipated release in the gaming industry, and many publishers do not want to release their games close to Rockstar‚Äôs new instalment. Players were worried, as no news about the game had been revealed since the trailer in December 2023. The community speculated that a delay could be imminent. However, since the game was announced, the developers have stayed strong with the 2025 release window. 

After the CEO of Take-Two recently made a statement, players hope Rockstar will provide more information soon to get them even more excited about Fall 2025. It would be exciting to see some new gameplay and glimpse all the fresh innovations Rockstar may have implemented. 

During the same earnings call, Take-Two‚Äôs CEO spoke about Nintendo‚Äôs upcoming console, Switch 2. However, it wasn‚Äôt confirmed whether their upcoming games, like Grand Theft Auto 6 and Borderlands 4, will be released on the platform. Also, NBA 2K25‚Äôs player spending ‚Äúgreatly surpassed‚Äù expectations. 

What are your thoughts on Take-Two stocks reaching an all-time high? Let us know in the comments or on our new community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Sony turning down the Resistance 4 pitch. Don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Resistance 4 Was Pitched By Insomniac, But PlayStation Turned It Down
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/resistance-4-was-pitched-by-insomniac-but-playstation-turned-it-down/

Insomniac Games wanted to develop Resistance 4, but PlayStation turned it down. That‚Äôs according to soon-to-be president of Insomniac Games Ted Price.

In a new interview with Kinda Funny Games, Price was asked about a favorite game of his that was pitched but never greenlit.

‚ÄúYeah, I‚Äôll share one,‚Äù Price said after a brief pause. ‚ÄúResistance 4.‚Äù

He continued: ‚ÄúWe did pitch that one and it was a wonderful concept, and, it just, in terms of timing and market opportunity, didn‚Äôt work out. But it was the result of a lot of Insomniac team members being passionate about extending the story further because I do believe that Resistance has set up a really cool alternate history base where anything can happen with the Chimera and where they go and what their origins are.‚Äù

Price said that they spent a lot of time working on backstory and brainstorming on where the series could go in the future.

‚ÄúPersonally, I love this franchise,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI was fortunate enough to be creative director on the first two Resistances. And I will remember many, many moments‚Äîgood and bad‚Äîwhen it comes to development that taught us all a lot about how we can elevate ourselves under some pretty difficult situations.‚Äù

Resistance, which first debuted with 2006‚Äôs Resistance: Fall of Man, hasn‚Äôt seen a mainline game since 2011‚Äôs Resistance 3. Price said that there‚Äôs no answer to the question of if the studio will ever develop another Resistance game, but it‚Äôs something he hopes will happen in the future.

What do you think of Price and Insomniac wanting to develop Resistance 4? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read about what Take-Two‚Äôs CEO had to say about the Nintendo Switch 2 and check out what Balatro developer LocalThunk said about the game‚Äôs next major update. And don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: Next Balatro Update Details Intentionally Being Kept Under Wraps
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/next-balatro-update-details-intentionally-being-kept-under-wraps/

There is going to be a major update coming to Balatro sometime in the future. What‚Äôs included in that update, however, is currently unknown, and that‚Äôs by design.

In a new interview with Bloomberg‚Äôs Jason Schreier, Balatro developer LocalThunk gave a small update on the next update he‚Äôs working on.

The update, which he calls a ‚Äú1.1‚Äù update for the game will include new Jokers along with various other features. LocalThunk didn‚Äôt want to get into exactly what those features will be because of potential constraints that would put on him such as the ability to ‚Äúpivot if something new doesn‚Äôt work.‚Äù

‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs healthier for the game that I keep my cards close to my chest, then give you the best version of whatever this new content update is,‚Äù he said.

LISTEN: GTA 6 Still On Track For 2025: Insider Gaming Weekly Podcast

Despite not wanting to give anything away, he did reveal two changes that will come with the update. The first is a change to the ‚Äúblue stake‚Äù modifier while the second is a change to the Matador Joker‚ÄîEarn $8 if played hand triggers the Boss Blind ability. As far as what those changes will involve, that wasn‚Äôt said. Details on that, along with everything else players can expect, will come closer to its release.

The update is expected to arrive sometime this year.

What are you hoping to see in the next Balatro update? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read about what Take-Two‚Äôs CEO had to say about the Nintendo Switch 2 and check out what a recently discovered patent shows for the Switch 2‚Äôs Joy-Con controllers. And don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: VALORANT Star Derke Pulls Off Sensational Fake Yoru Clone Play
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/valorant-star-derke-pulls-off-sensational-fake-yoru-clone-play/

In a VALORANT match with massive qualifying implications, Vitality star Nikita ‚ÄúDerke‚Äù Sirmitev busted out the silliest play in the playbook. And somehow, the gamble worked, leaving his opponents embarrassed, and insuring a spot for his own team at the first Masters event of the year.

Derke Does The Unthinkable

In the upper bracket final of the VCT EMEA Kickoff, Vitality and Team Heretics went haed-to-head for one of two spots at Masters Bangkok. To beat Heretics, a two-time grand finalist at international events in 2024, Vitality would need to play with the utmost confidence.

Derke, the former star of Fnatic who switched to Vitality this past offseason, certainly didn‚Äôt lack confidence when he caught Heretics off guard with the fake Yoru clone. Typically, when a Yoru player uses their Fakeout ability, they send a clone forward that will hit enemies that shoot it with a blinding flash. So normally, enemy players just ignore the clone walking completely straight forward.

Unfortunately for Heretics, it wasn‚Äôt Derke‚Äôs clone that walked onto the site, it was Derke pretending to be his clone. To make matters worse, Heretics‚Äô Riƒçardas ‚ÄúBoo‚Äù Luka≈°eviƒçius teleported right next to Derke before he turned, gifting him an additional kill. It‚Äôs a play that VALORANT fans have sometimes seen during streams and maybe in their own ranked games, but never on a pro stage as big as this one. The play also gifted Vitality a bonus round win, taking a third straight round to start Haven despite not completely buying. Vitality ended up winning Haven, and then owned Heretics‚Äô own map pick of Abyss to claim the series, and the Masters spot, in dominant fashion.

Have you ever fallen victim to the Yoru fake clone play? Let us know what you think down below or in the official Insider Gaming forums.

Check out more of the latest esports news, and don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: GTA 6 Still On Track For 2025: Insider Gaming Weekly Podcast
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/gta-6-still-on-track-for-2025-insider-gaming-weekly-podcast/

Welcome everyone to Insider Gaming Weekly: A Video Game Podcast for February 7, 2025. In this week‚Äôs episode: MultiVersus is shutting down, Battlefield is cooking, and Grand Theft Auto 6 is still planned for this year.

Mike, Grant, and Albert also get the Bragging Rights trivia contest underway with‚Ä¶underwhelming results. And Tom Henderson joins as we bring the latest on Sony Santa Monica‚Äôs plans for the God of War franchise as well as talk about what we think and hope we‚Äôll see at the next PlayStation State of Play event.

It‚Äôs Insider Gaming Weekly: A Video Game Podcast!

If you enjoy the show, please consider subscribing (links below) and leaving a rating and review. You can also submit questions for future shows and your feedback to ‚Å†[email protected]‚Å†.

About The Show

Each and every Friday, Senior Editors Mike Straw and Grant Taylor-Hill alongside Senior Producer Albert Perkins bring you the latest in video game news, events, rumors and more.

From friendly debates to challenges for the audience and each other, you don‚Äôt want to miss a single thing from Insider Gaming Weekly. Even Insider Gaming Co-Founder Tom Henderson will stop by from time to time to talk the latest in gaming rumors that players need to know about.

Don‚Äôt forget to share the show and leave a rating to help us grow this new venture. You can also submit questions for future shows and your feedback to ‚Å†[email protected]‚Å†.

Join the Discussion

If you want to talk about the latest episode of the show with the hosts and staff, head on over to the Insider Gaming Forums where you can hangout with other gamers and listeners, and talk about everything from your favorite games and shows to even sharing your best in-game artwork. It‚Äôs all there at the Insider Gaming Forums.
